thread.section_title: WDT News Feed: Watertown Daily Times: Local Sports
thread.title: College roundup: Howe’s goals jump-start Clarkson women’s hockey win
thread.title_full: College roundup: Howe’s goals jump-start Clarkson women’s hockey win

title: College roundup: Howe’s goals jump-start Clarkson women’s hockey win
text:
A A 
BOSTON — Olivia Howe scored the first two goals of the game to spark No. 4 Clarkson to a 4-1 victory over No. 9 Boston University in a nonconference women’s hockey game Saturday afternoon. 
Genevieve Bannon scored the final two goals for the Golden Knights (7-0 overall), who picked up a weekend sweep of the Terriers. Sammy Davis scored for Boston (3-3). 
MEN’S SOCCER 
ST. LAWRENCE 8, UNION 0 
Jonathan Mendoza and Harry Copeland each scored two goals to lead St. Lawrence past Union (7-2-4, 1-1-3) in a Liberty League game in Canton. 
Christian Yarros, Ryan Roche, Jonathan Mendoza, Charlton Kelly and Dan Hunt also scored for the Saints (10-3-2, 4-2). 
RPI 3, CLARKSON 1 
Devon Baughen and Andrew Gondek each scored one goal and assisted on another to lead the Engineers (9-3-3, 2-2-2) past the Golden Knights in a Liberty League game in Potsdam. 
Max Leetz scored for Clarkson (4-8-2, 1-4-1). 
SUNY POTSDAM 2, SUNY FREDONIA 1 
Jorge Ferrer scored in the 38th minute to lead the Bears (9-5-1, 3-3-1) in a SUNYAC game in Potsdam. 
Brandon Laurin also scored for the Bears. Ryan Keller scored in the 33rd minute for SUNY Fredonia (2-10-3, 1-4-2). 
CASTLETON STATE 5, SUNY CANTON 1 
Jake Tietgens scored the first two goals to lead host Castleton State (10-5-1) in a nonconference game. 
Andrew Meister, Seth Wilmott and Nihad Basic also scored for Castleton State. Nick Escalante scored for SUNY Canton (4-11). 
JEFFERSON CC 1, NIAGARA CCC 0 
Thomas Leech scored on an assist from Matt Guyette in the 69th minute to send the Cannoneers to a Region 3 victory over the Thunder Wolves (4-10-1) in Sanborn. Hayden Peterson stopped three shots to secure the shutout for JCC (7-7). 
WOMEN’S SOCCER 
ST. LAWRENCE 2, UNION 0 
Kelsey West stopped four shots to lead St. Lawrence past Union (7-4-3, 3-3) in a Liberty League game in Schenectady. 
Lindsay Geier and Katelyn Daley scored for SLU (9-3-1, 2-3-1). 
CLARKSON 1, RPI 1 (OT) 
Dali Alarian scored on a penalty kick in the 86th minute to help RPI (5-6, 1-2-3) salvage a Liberty League tie with Clarkson in Troy. Lauren Flynn scored in the 55th minute for Clarkson (7-5-2, 0-4-2). 
SUNY FREDONIA 3, SUNY POTSDAM 2 (OT) 
Kristie Kleine scored all three goals for SUNY Fredonia (4-10-1, 2-4-1), including the game-winner in overtime, in a SUNYAC win in Fredonia. 
Amber Hyatt and Brooke Falsion scored for the Bears (8-6-1, 3-4). 
JEFFERSON CC 7, NIAGARA CCC 0 
Bryanna Gagnon generated three goals and two assists while starting goalie Katie Aldrich scored twice, and made four saves, as the Cannoneers cruised to a Region 3 shutout of the Thunder Wolves (0-15) at Sanborn. 
Taylor Andrews and Kerstin Phelps added a goal apiece for Jefferson Community College (3-8-1). 
CROSS COUNTRY 
KELLOGG CLAIMS TITLE 
SLU sophomore Megan Kellogg was the overall winner in the women’s race at the Wisconsin-Oshkosh Invitational with a 6-kilometer time of 21 minutes, 11.70 seconds. SLU’s Lisa Grohn was 10th. 
SLU’s women finished in seventh place with 270 points. St. Louis’s Washington University won with 136 points. 
SLU’s men, led by a seventh-place finish from Thomas Caufield, finished in third with 174 points. 
CLARKSON SWEEPS IN GENEVA 
Clarkson’s men’s and women’s teams both took the titles at the CCOC Championship in Geneva. 
Clarkson’s women were led by individual winner Sarah Duclos and finished with 31 points. Victoria Hathaway was third for Clarkson. SUNY Potsdam finished fifth and SUNY Canton was 12th. Aine McMorrow finished in second individually for the Kangaroos. 
Clarkson’s men finished with 22 points led by a second-place finish from Ryan Recchia. A.J. Beers was third and Jacob Dowman was fourth. SUNY Potsdam finished fourth and SUNY Canton was 10th. 
MACAULAY PACES JCC 
Kurstyn Macaulay placed first overall and led Jefferson Community College to a first-place finish in the Mid-State Athletic Conference women’s meet at Finger Lakes CC. 
Cori Mainville and Reganne Smith finished second and fourth, respectively, to lead the Cannoneers. After the meet, Macaulay was named the conference’s runner of the year, and JCC’s Dan Godin was named Coach of the Year. 
For the men’s team, Alex Hall posted a second-place showing and the Cannoneers finished third, behind Broome CC and Onondaga CC. 
VOLLEYBALL 
CLARKSON DROPS PAIR 
Rachael Aird finished with 15 kills but Clarkson (20-6) dropped a pair of matches at the Midwest Invitational in Grand Rapids, Mich. 
Calvin defeated the Golden Knights 25-21, 28-26, 25-16 and Hope swept Clarkson 25-16, 25-16, 25-20. 
KANGAROOS WIN INVITATIONAL 
SUNY Canton (20-7) swept Hunter 25-15, 25-15, 25-21 and SUNY Geneseo 25-18, 25-23, 25-22 to finish 4-0 at the Elmira Invitational. Morgan Bills led the Kangaroos with 30 kills. 
SAINTS FALL TWICE 
Cristina Deschaine produced 10 kills in the second match of the day for SLU (13-14), which was swept 25-23, 25-13, 25-17 by SUNY New Paltz and then lost 29-27, 25-18, 19-25, 25-19 to Western New England. Masha Kolesnikova and Grace Kelly each picked up seven kills for SLU against New Paltz. 
BEARS SWEPT 
Stephanie Maddox finished with 15 kills but the Bears (6-18) were swept in a pair of matches at Brockport. 
Hilbert defeated SUNY Potsdam 25-17 25-12, 25-16 and SUNY Brockport picked up a 25-17, 25-18, 25-9 sweep. 
JCC SWEEPS REGION 3 MATCHES 
Kaety Hanlin provided 36 service points and 39 digs as Jefferson Community College ended its regular season by sweeping a trio of Region 3 opponents in Williamsville. 
The Cannoneers beat Erie CC (13-25, 25-15, 25-21, 25-20), Jamestown CC (11-25, 25-12, 25-21, 25-13) and Niagara CCC (25-18, 25-7, 25-21). 
Grace Wallace added 39 digs and 24 kills, and Alea Gentles generated 26 kills and 10 blocks for JCC, which is seeded third and will play No. 2 Broome CC in the semifinals of the Mid-State Athletic Conference Tournament Saturday at Corning. 
FIELD HOCKEY 
ST. LAWRENCE 2, NAZARETH 1 
Maggie Wraight and Jamie Oriol scored goals to send the Saints (4-8) past Nazareth in a nonconference game in Canton. 
Emily Prescott scored for Nazareth (6-9).
